intro: Lophanthus nepetoides, commonly known as the Indian balm, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple. It is often cultivated for its medicinal properties and pleasant fragrance. Lophanthus nepetoides thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and herbal gardens.
